title: Enhancing e-Learning Practical Skills: Comparative Analysis of Instructional Design Decision-Making Processes—Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core principles and application methods of five instructional design approaches (4SPPIces, 4Ts, e-Design Template, Design Principles Database, Design Narrative).
Learners can analyze similarities and differences among instructional design models to select contextually appropriate approaches.
Learners can apply a decision-making process to improve instructional design based on formative assessment results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
